results.title: Tame the wind
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Selig Alkon
results.brief_description: Shows how we are now moving to learn to modify the weather to our own ends. The film offers some examples of how weather modification is practised today, and also takes viewers to the Nile Basin where a meteorological survey evokes a far-off dream of making some of the world’s driest desert terrain fertile and fruitful.

results.title: Tamara's tapestry world
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Tadeusz Jaworski
results.brief_description: Tamara is an artist in a field both ancient and modern - tapestry. She is a world-renowned Polish Canadian whose works are hung, from the National Gallery of Canada to the Hermitage in Leningrad. This film is not a ‘how to’ film as much as a portrait of one of the century’s most brilliant artists.

results.title: Tall timbers
results.brief_description: A young forestry graduate, Jim Thornton, is involved in a race between timber companies to fill a major contract. Jim has joined the crew of a genial timber baron, Burbridge, and foils attempts by a rival, Blake, to sabotage their work. J. Alan Kenyon’s special effects are the highlights of the film with comic relief provided by Joe Valli as a Scottish timber-train driver amorously pursued by a shrill-voiced maid of the Burbridge’s country house. Stars Frank Leighton, Shirley Ann Richards and Letty Craydon.

results.title: Talks: a Natimuk Primary School animation
results.creator_credit: Dave Jones and Natimuk Primary School
results.brief_description: A collaboration between students from Natimuk Primary School and animation artists Dave Jones funded as part of the Arts Victoria Artists in Schools program. Hand drawn crayon drawings are animated and Combined with recorded soundgrabs from the kids to make an engaging sequence of simple, colourful character studies!

results.title: Talking Trade
results.creator_credit: Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Monica Pellizzari
results.brief_description: Looks at ways Australia could expand trade to other countries, particularly the Arab world, by drawing on the language skills of its ethnic population. The video looks at examples of industries and individuals who have benefited by acknowledging their cultural roots, maintaining their language and recognising their own potential, for the key to trade with other countries is communication and understanding of other cultures. Accompanied by Teacher’s notes.

results.title: Talking to the Moon
results.creator_credit: Franco Di Chiera, Margaret Smith and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A group of Australians are taken back to the quarantine station which was their first experience of their new country when they arrived as migrants. A labyrinth of cold, tiny cubicles enclosed by imposing stone walls the quarantine station was, for over 50 years, the first Australian home for thousands of immigrants. Through interviews with women and men who passed the station we gain an understanding of the hardships undergone by migrants in their initial years in a new land.

results.title: Talking to Australians
results.brief_description: This video and guide were prepared to aid overseas students’ undestanding of communication in Australia. They allow the student to consider the similarities and differences in social rules that exist between cultures. The video is 18 minutes long and includes 10 scenes illustrating communication difficulties that the student may experience whilst living in Australia. The guide has been designed to follow the scenes in the video, briefly summarising each scene, discussing potential questions, and commenting about the situation and the associated socil rule.
